page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: { General Review The block is predominantly rural, woodland and farmland. The population is restricted to a dense band of pre and post war housing to the west. Since 1980 the Elmdon Heath area has been developed. Luxury type housing, a private hospital and nursing home have been constructed. The population is served by Coppice Junior School and Yew Tree Primary School. At the centre of the block is the village of Catherine de Barnes, cut in two by the Grand Union Canal. To the east the M42 motorway cuts across the farmland and the River Blythe, from north to south. {Of interest} Old Berry Hall-16th century moated Manor House, Catherine de Barnes-village bakery and Inn, Grand Union Canal path and towpath
